TopicTitle: Burn to Orbit using the Ascent Autopilot?

Articles.Content: Would it be possible to use the Mechjeb ascent autopilot to make a 100KM orbit from the ground on only one continuous burn? I\'ve been trying to do it but I can\'t figure out what the settings should be.
MechJeb is not programmed to get to orbit that way. Why would you want to do a single burn to orbit?

Change your turn height a lot lower, but it\'ll take more fuel since your path is less linear. 

Also, try 10 to 100 and slide the slider around to give yourself a shallower turn, that\'ll help

> 
> MechJeb is not programmed to get to orbit that way. Why would you want to do a single burn to orbit?

Just for realism.

> 
> Just for realism.

Which rockets use a single burn to orbit?

Saturn V. Upon SECO, the craft would already be in orbit. In real life, they don\'t burn into a sub orbital trajectory and ignite their engines at Apogee. The Shuttle does a single burn, too I\'m pretty sure.
Is it possible to make a craft blow up in mid air? How can I do that if I want to blow up a spacecraft during launch?
One of the parts packs has a little solid that overheats and blows up whatever it\'s attached to, also, why would you want that?

> 
> One of the parts packs has a little solid that overheats and blows up whatever it\'s attached to, also, why would you want that?

I want to try something. Do you know what parts pack it is?

> 
> This one: [http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=5660.0](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=5660.0)

Thanks. I\'ll give it a try

The space shuttle didn\'t use a single burn to orbit.

Seems like you\'ll have to do the single burn to orbit manually.

> 
> The space shuttle didn\'t use a single burn to orbit.
> 
> Seems like you\'ll have to do the single burn to orbit manually.

MechJeb \*almost\* did it. The Saturn V \*definitely\* did a single burn to orbit (not counting the pauses between stage separations)
